title: Tensors stuck as variables
body_html:
OS: macOS 10.12
PyTorch version: 0.4.0a0+15eae95 installed from source
Python Version: 3.6.3

New tensors defined seem to come through as variables. Trying to access the tensor from the variable also does not seem to work.

A minimal repro:

import torch

type(torch.Tensor([0]))

returns torch.autograd.variable.Variable.

Similarly:

import torch

type(torch.Tensor([0]).data)

also returns torch.autograd.variable.Variable.

Thanks for looking into this, and apologies if I am mistaken.

body:
OS: macOS 10.12
PyTorch version: 0.4.0a0+15eae95 installed from source
Python Version: 3.6.3

New tensors defined seem to come through as variables. Trying to access the tensor from the variable also does not seem to work.

A minimal repro:


```
import torch

type(torch.Tensor([0]))
```


returns `torch.autograd.variable.Variable`.

Similarly:

```
import torch

type(torch.Tensor([0]).data)
```
also returns `torch.autograd.variable.Variable`.

Thanks for looking into this, and apologies if I am mistaken.
